text: your European partners in the eurozone
say that a no vote on Sunday actually
brings Greece closer to the idea of

the fact is is that the series of
governments position and the position of

very very very far apart so even if this
government continues negotiations as of
Monday on what and with what chance of
success I mean how much can we promise
to that 2% chance of success as I told
you the most interesting proposals have
come to us after the banks closed and
this supposed impasse between us and our
partners hit the headlines maybe things
have to get far worse before they get
better
will the bank's open on Monday after the
referendum Tuesday for sure yes with
what cash well all that needs to happen
is for the ACP together greenlight for

group that the agreement has been

whether a yes or a No comes up through

be a bad agreement the banks will open
with a bad agreement and you will be
back here discussing with my successor
because it won't be me the terrible
negotiations that would begin again
under a very similar circumstance for no
wins we are going to have another
agreement which would be viable along
the lines of proposals made to us in the
last few days this is a terrible thing
about Europe we have a very bad system
of governance in Europe and this is not
a way to run a monetary union this is a
travesty it's a comedy of errors for
five years now Europe has been extending
and pretending and we said no to this
the program that have imposed upon this

imposing the same logic here it's going
to go down in economic history as the

you
your government I what I said was we
will make sure that the people's verdict
